articles.title: CSS: Making the web pretty
articles.author: Amalkong
articles.summary: Cascading Style Sheet is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language like HTML. CSS is a cornerstone technology of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and Javascript.

articles.title: Javascript: Dinamics in a few lines
articles.author: Amalkong
articles.summary: Javascript, often abbreviated as JS, is a high-level, interpreted programming language. It is a language which also is characterized as dynamic, weakly typed, prototype-based and multi-paradigm. Alogside HTML ad CSS, Javascript is one of the three core technologies of the World Wide Web. Javascript enables interactive web pages and thus is a essential part of web applications.

articles.title: Python Programming Language
articles.author: Amalkong
articles.summary: Python is a general-purpose, high-level programming language[5] whose design philosophy emphasizes code readability. Python claims to '[combine] remarkable power with very clear syntax',[7] and its standard library is large and comprehensive. Its use of indentation for block delimiters is unique among popular programming languages. Python supports multiple programming paradigms, primarily but not limited to object-oriented,imperative and, to a lesser extent, functional programming styles. It features a fully dynamic type system and automatic memory management, similar to that of Scheme, Ruby, Perl, and Tcl. Like other dynamic languages, Python is often used as a scripting language, but is also used in a wide range of non-scripting contexts.

articles.title: PERL Programming Language
articles.author: Amalkong
articles.summary:
Perl is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language.
Perl was originally developed by Larry Wall in 1987 as a general-purpose Unix scripting language to make report processing easier. Since then, it has undergone many changes and revisions and become widely popular amongst programmers. Larry Wall continues to oversee development of the core language, and its upcoming version, Perl 6. Perl borrows features from other programming languages including C, shell scripting (sh), AWK, and sed.[5] The language provides powerful text processing facilities without the arbitrary data length limits of many contemporary Unix tools, facilitating easy manipulation of text files.

articles.title: ASP.NET Programming Language
articles.author: Amalkong
articles.summary: ASP.NET is a web application framework developed and marketed by Microsoft to allowÂ  programmers to build dynamic web sites, web applications and web services. It was first released in January 2002 with version 1.0 of the .NET Framework, and is the successor to Microsoft's Active Server Pages (ASP) technology. ASP.NET is built on the Common Language Runtime (CLR), allowing programmers to write ASP.NET code using any supported .NET language. The ASP.NET SOAP extension framework allows ASP.NET components to process SOAP messages.

articles.title: PHP: The most popular server-side language
articles.author: Amalkong
articles.summary: PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor is a server side scripting language designed for Web Development, but also used as a general-purpose programming language. It was originally created by Rasmus Lerdorf in 1994. PHP originally stood for Personal Home Page, but now stands for the recusive accronym PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor.

articles.title: Github has been sold to Microsoft, what are the implications
articles.author: Andre Lewis
articles.summary: The sale of Github to Microsoft has caused some uproar in the development community, but are the implications?
articles.body:
Github sold to Microsoft?
While this is not fresh or breaking news as this was announced about six month ago, i've always wonder
what this will mean for the github users, because I myself is a satisfied user.

For those who don't know, What is Github?
Github Inc. is a web-based hosting service for
version control using Git. It is
mostly used for computer code. It offers all of the distribution version control and source code managenement (SCM) functionality of Git
as well as adding its own features. It provides access control and several collaboration features such as bug traacking, feature resquests,
task managenement, and wikis for every project. Github offers plans for both
private repositories and free accounts which are comoly used to host open-source software projects.
As of June 2018, Github reports having over 28 million users and 57 million repositories (including 28 million public repositories),
making it the largest host of source code in the world.

I have some apprehensions about this sale (which is reported to be about $7.5 Billion) because i'm not a big fan of microsoft and I can't seem to shake the feeling they are going to change the core model of github into a model more commercially driven towards their financial gain.
I have been surfing around the net and found that there are others who share my concerns and there seems to be even a movement on github itself to evacuate.

This excerp was taken from wikipedia ¬
There have been concerns fro developers such as Kyle Simpson, Javascript trainer and author and Rafael Laguna, CEO at Open-Xchange (wiki:Open-Xchange) over Microsoft's purchase,
citing uneasiness over Microsoft's handling of previous acquisitions, such as Nokia mobile business or skype.
Some saw this as a culmination of Microsoft's recent changes in business trategy under CEO Satya Nadella, shich has seen a larger focus on the sale of cloud computing services as it's main line of business alongside development of and contributions to open source software (such as Linux),
as opposed to the Microsoft Windows operating system. It is argued by some that Microsoft was intending to acquire Github to get access to its userbase, so it can be used as a loss leader to
encourage use of its other development products and services.

As stated previously, this sale has not gone well with some user and this has led to bolstered interest in some of github's main competitors such as Bitbucket, GitLab and SourceForge.
They have reported that they had seen spikes in new users intending to migrate projects from github to their respective services.
Now me personally, I don't plan on going anywhere anytime soon unless i'm left no other choice and I suspect the sentiment is the same for a majority of github users.
For a different look into the sale I suggest reading this article

articles.title: Obsolescense .... What Does It Mean Really!
articles.author: Andre Lewis
articles.summary: This article explore what does Obsolescence really Mean to consumers.
articles.body:
Obsolescence .... What Does It Mean. Really!
Have you ever had something for example an electronic gadget and for some reason it starts to malfunction
or die altogether? Have you ever wondered what caused that, well I did and probably you have so.... I did some digging and this is what I found; I came across this word: Obsolescence.

What does that mean?

'Obsolescence is the state of being which occurs when an object, service, or practice is no longer wanted'


I further found out there are different types also; Technical, Functional, Architectural, Style and Planned.
After seeing this list the most obvious one I thought that caused the problem I am having would be Planned Obsolescence.
  
What does this mean?
This is from wikipedia taken from the main article: Planned Obsolescence
 
'Sometimes marketers deliberately introduce obsolescence into their product strategy, with the objective of generating long-term sales
 volume by reducing the time between repeat purchases. One example might be producing an appliance which is deliberately
 designed to wear out within five years of its purchase pushing consumers to replace it within five years.'


Going off what is said, it would seem that no matter how you take care a product, it is going to fail and that's just f@*#ked up.

articles.title: Progress Uppubdate
articles.author: klumzy bone
articles.summary: This post give's insight into the group's latest progress on our musical jouney. Updates will be made to this post as they become available.
articles.body:
So far the inititial song is nearing completion, althought that has been said already. It's hit numerous snags, which leads me to think that this may actually be the catapult we need to kickstart the Uknknown Colonisation.

The trademarking process was initiated a couple months back with the trademark search, which checks for the existence of our name. 

Update 2015-08-09-20:37:43 :

The first official song from our label has officially been completed. Although I havn't heard it yet, i'm very excited to hear the final mix. Stay posted for my un-biased opinion on the quality of the finished product. As soon as I can, I will provide links to you,(whether internal or external link like our soundcloud profile) to critique the song for yourself.
